content:
just a heads up: it seems that lintcheck fails to build since the last clippy sync (due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/95267 ).
The fix is already merged ( https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95390 ) but we will need another bootstrap-rustc-compiler-bump until the fix is also present for the pinned rustc version :upside_down:
The next planned sync is on release day in 9 days. Do we have to do an out of cycle sync or is it not that important?

hm, well for now I am getting 2 mails a day that ci at https://github.com/matthiaskrgr/clippy-lintcheck fails due to build ^^
it would be nice to have that fixed and running again

Its probably enough to just do a rustc-> clippy sync now to just bump the bootstrap compiler inside clippy repo (I just clone clippy repo and do something like cargo run for lintcheck so it uses the pinned version and does not use nightly clippy or anything.
No need to do the whole rustc->clippy clippy->rustc sync dance.
